basics.name: Rosemary Koikara
basics.label: AI Video Analytics Expert
basics.summary: A Software Engineer with over 4 years of experience in backend development, specializing in building distributed systems and GPU-optimized solutions. My expertise spans various languages and technologies, including C++, Python, Docker, with a strong foundation in AI and cryptography. I have a proven track record of driving innovation in complex environments, leading projects that enhance system performance, scalability, and efficiency. I thrive in collaborative settings and am eager to leverage my skills to make a substantial impact.

work.name: Pintel Co. Ltd.
work.position: AI Researcher and Developer - Team Lead
work.summary: Leading AI research and development projects focused on video analytics.
highlights: Led the design and implementation of custom GStreamer plugins for real-time object detection and video analytics, achieving a 30% improvement in tracking accuracy.
Directed a multinational project between the UK and South Korea to develop an AI-driven accident prevention system, enhancing video classification capabilities by 25%.
Spearheaded research into AVC/HEVC integration, developing a motion detection system that increased detection precision for traffic events by 20%.
Developed advanced incident detection systems for urban traffic safety, leading to multiple US and Korean patents.

work.name: Kyungpook National University
work.summary: Contributed to various research projects in information security and computer vision.
highlights: Secured patents for advanced technologies in automatic number plate recognition and video watermarking.
Pioneered blockchain applications for information security.
Developed a cryptographic key manufacturing module for multi-party communication systems.
Contributed to government-funded projects focusing on image watermarking and video copyright software.

awards.title: SAC'16 Student Research Competition
awards.summary: Received first place for independent student research paper, 'A 3D-Cellular Automata based Pseudo-random Number Generator'.
